junction.name: dataset_bundle_members
junction.brief: Links a dataset to a bundle.
junction.description:
Junction table linking bundles to their constituent datasets. Uses codes
for loose coupling - allows declaring membership for datasets that may not
yet exist in the system.

Examples:
- Bundle "slovaris" contains "slovaris.countries", "slovaris.currencies", etc.
- Bundle "base" contains "iso.countries", "iso.currencies", all FpML datasets

left.index_comment: Index for looking up datasets in a bundle
left.description: Code of the bundle this membership belongs to.

right.index_comment: Index for finding bundles containing a dataset
right.description: Code of the dataset that is a member of the bundle.

columns.name: display_order
columns.description: Order in which this dataset should be displayed or processed.
columns.detail:
Lower numbers appear first. Used for controlling installation order
and UI presentation.
